related.meaning: to exceed (esp. figures: profits, unemployment rate, etc.)

lessons.japanese: ユミがそれを１日で仕上げるのは不可能です。
lessons.english: It is impossible for Yumi to finish it in a day.

lessons.japanese: それを仕上げる前に作業をやめる時間となるだろう。
lessons.english: It will be quitting time before you get that done.

lessons.japanese: その仕事を一ヶ月以内に仕上げるのは全く不可能である。
lessons.english: It is utterly impossible to finish the work within a month.

lessons.japanese: そのレポートを明日までに仕上げるのはほとんど不可能だ。
lessons.english: Finishing the report by tomorrow is next to impossible.

lessons.japanese: １週間でそのレポートを仕上げるなんて不可能だ。
lessons.english: It is impossible to finish the report in a week.

lessons.japanese: １時間でその仕事を仕上げるのは難しい。
lessons.english: It is hard to get through the work in an hour.

lessons.japanese: 明日までに仕上げる必要はありません。
lessons.english: You needn't finish it by tomorrow.

lessons.japanese: 明日までに仕上げる必要はありません。
lessons.english: You don't need to finish it by tomorrow.

lessons.japanese: 明日までに、私は学期末レポートを仕上げることはできない。
lessons.english: It is impossible for me to finish my term paper by tomorrow.

lessons.japanese: 明日までに、私は学期末レポートを仕上げることはできない。
lessons.english: It's impossible for me to finish my term paper by tomorrow.

lessons.japanese: 明日までに、私は学期末レポートを仕上げることはできない。
lessons.english: It'll be impossible for me to finish my term paper by tomorrow.

lessons.japanese: 彼はそれを期限内に仕上げるのが精いっぱいだった。
lessons.english: He had to work as hard as he could to finish it in time.

lessons.japanese: 彼の話で仕事を仕上げる気がなくなった。
lessons.english: His speech indisposed us to finish the work any more.

lessons.japanese: 彼がそれを一時間で仕上げる事は不可能だ。
lessons.english: It is impossible for him to finish it in an hour.
